abstract: Dwight Garner Critic’s Notebook concludes that Greil Marcus’s 1975 music tome, Mystery Train: Images of America in Rock ‘n’ Roll Music, is all-time best book on American art and culture.
lead_paragraph: “Mystery Train” may be the best book ever written about rock music. Which isn’t far from saying it may be the best book ever written about being alive.

headline.main: Just a Book? No, More Like a Trusty Companion
headline.print_headline: When a Book Became a Trusty Companion

snippet: “Mystery Train” may be the best book ever written about rock music. Which isn’t far from saying it may be the best book ever written about being alive.
